possibleValues.modify: A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)
possibleValues.move: The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2
possibleValues.set: The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node
possibleValues.clear: All the children nodes were removed
possibleValues.insert: A child node was inserted at index1
possibleValues.none: No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant
possibleValues.setall: All the children nodes were replaced
possibleValues.remove: A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed

rightDividerUri.name: rightDividerUri
rightDividerUri.description: Specifies the URI of the bitmap to be used as the divider between the clock and the options prompt on the right side of the overhang
rightDividerUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the URI of the bitmap to be used as the divider between the clock and the options prompt on the right side of the overhang

focusable.name: focusable
focusable.description: Provides a hint as to whether or not this node can take the key focus
focusable.descriptionHTML: Provides a hint as to whether or not this node can take the key focus

logoUri.name: logoUri
logoUri.description: Specifies the URI of a bitmap to be drawn on the left side of the overhang. If both a logo and a title are specified, the logo will be displayed to the left of the title, separated by a vertical divider.
logoUri.descriptionHTML:
Specifies the URI of a bitmap to be drawn on the left side of the overhang.

If both a logo and a title are specified, the logo will be displayed to the left of the title, separated by a vertical divider.

inheritParentTransform.name: inheritParentTransform
inheritParentTransform.description: If true, the node overall transformation is determined by combining the accumulated transformation matrix of all of its ancestors in the scene graph with the node local 2D transformation matrix described by its translation, rotation, scale and scaleRotateCenter fields. If false, the accumulated transformation of all of its ancestors in the Scene Graph is ignored and only the node local transformation matrix is used. This causes the node to be transformed relative to the root of the Scene Graph (that is, the Scene component).
inheritParentTransform.descriptionHTML: If true, the node overall transformation is determined by combining the accumulated transformation matrix of all of its ancestors in the scene graph with the node local 2D transformation matrix described by its translation, rotation, scale and scaleRotateCenter fields. If false, the accumulated transformation of all of its ancestors in the Scene Graph is ignored and only the node local transformation matrix is used. This causes the node to be transformed relative to the root of the Scene Graph (that is, the Scene component).

renderPass.name: renderPass
renderPass.description: Used in combination with the numRenderPasses field of nodes extended from the  abstract node class, to optimize rendering of lists and grids. This should never be set to a non-zero value unless you are optimizing the performance of a list or grid rendering by specifying the sequence of rendering operations for sub-elements of the list or grid items, and have set the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid to a value greater than 1. If the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid is set to a value greater than 1, you must set this field to a value greater than 0 for all sub-elements of the list or grid items, and not greater than the numRenderPasses field value. If the numRenderPasses field is set to a value greater than 1, and you set this field for a list or grid item sub-element to 0 (the default), or a value greater than the numRenderPasses field value, the list or grid item sub-element will not render.
renderPass.descriptionHTML: Used in combination with the numRenderPasses field of nodes extended from the  abstract node class, to optimize rendering of lists and grids. This should never be set to a non-zero value unless you are optimizing the performance of a list or grid rendering by specifying the sequence of rendering operations for sub-elements of the list or grid items, and have set the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid to a value greater than 1. If the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid is set to a value greater than 1, you must set this field to a value greater than 0 for all sub-elements of the list or grid items, and not greater than the numRenderPasses field value. If the numRenderPasses field is set to a value greater than 1, and you set this field for a list or grid item sub-element to 0 (the default), or a value greater than the numRenderPasses field value, the list or grid item sub-element will not render.

showClock.name: showClock
showClock.description: Specifies whether or not the Clock is displayed as part of the annotations that appear on the right side of the Overhang.If both the clock and the options prompt are shown, the clock will be displayed to the left of the options prompt, separated by a vertical divider
showClock.descriptionHTML:
Specifies whether or not the Clock is displayed as part of the annotations that appear on the right side of the Overhang.

If both the clock and the options prompt are shown, the clock will be displayed to the left of the options prompt, separated by a vertical divider

childRenderOrder.name: childRenderOrder
childRenderOrder.description: If the value is renderFirst, any drawing done by this node will be done before the node children are rendered. If the value is renderLast, any drawing done by this node will be done after the node children are rendered.
childRenderOrder.descriptionHTML: If the value is renderFirst, any drawing done by this node will be done before the node children are rendered. If the value is renderLast, any drawing done by this node will be done after the node children are rendered.

clippingRect.name: clippingRect
clippingRect.description: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.
clippingRect.descriptionHTML: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.

translation.name: translation
translation.description: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.
translation.descriptionHTML: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.

optionsColor.name: optionsColor
optionsColor.description: Specifies the color of the options indicator when the options key is available (i.e. the showOptions field is set to true)
optionsColor.descriptionHTML: Specifies the color of the options indicator when the options key is available (i.e. the showOptions field is set to true)

optionsAvailable.name: optionsAvailable
optionsAvailable.description: Specifies whether the Options key is currently available. If optionsAvailable is set to true, the options prompt will have an brighter appearance. If false, the options prompt will be dimmed.
optionsAvailable.descriptionHTML: Specifies whether the Options key is currently available. If optionsAvailable is set to true, the options prompt will have an brighter appearance. If false, the options prompt will be dimmed.

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.
opacity.descriptionHTML: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.

backgroundUri.name: backgroundUri
backgroundUri.description: Specifies the URI of a bitmap that is used to fill the area occupied by the overhang. The color field and the backgroundUri field are "last one wins" fields. Whichever of these fields is set later overrides the other one.
backgroundUri.descriptionHTML:
Specifies the URI of a bitmap that is used to fill the area occupied by the overhang.

The color field and the backgroundUri field are "last one wins" fields. Whichever of these fields is set later overrides the other one.

leftDividerVertOffset.name: leftDividerVertOffset
leftDividerVertOffset.description: Specifies a vertical offset to add to the position of the divider between the logo and the title on the left side of the overhang. By default, the bottom of the divider bitmap is drawn at baseline offset of the logo bitmap, as specified by the logoBaselineOffset field.
leftDividerVertOffset.descriptionHTML: Specifies a vertical offset to add to the position of the divider between the logo and the title on the left side of the overhang. By default, the bottom of the divider bitmap is drawn at baseline offset of the logo bitmap, as specified by the logoBaselineOffset field.

Overhang.name: Overhang
Overhang.description: The Overhang node provides a information bar that is displayed at the top of a screen in many Roku channels. The regions occupied by the overhang can be filled with either a solid color or a bitmap.On the left side, a logo bitmap and/or a string can be displayed. If both are displayed, a vertical divider is drawn to separate them. The string is typically set to display a reminder to the user of their current location in the interface. For example, in the Roku homescreen, the string is set to "Search" while the user in the search entry portion of the user interface. Then when the user explores a search result, the string is changed to reflect the name of the content being explored.On the right side, a clock and/or an indicator that the options key (*) is available can be displayed. If both are displayed, a vertical divider is drawn to separate them.The appearance and contents of the Overhang can be customized by setting its fields to the desired values.
Overhang.descriptionHTML: The Overhang node provides a information bar that is displayed at the top of a screen in many Roku channels. The regions occupied by the overhang can be filled with either a solid color or a bitmap.On the left side, a logo bitmap and/or a string can be displayed. If both are displayed, a vertical divider is drawn to separate them. The string is typically set to display a reminder to the user of their current location in the interface. For example, in the Roku homescreen, the string is set to "Search" while the user in the search entry portion of the user interface. Then when the user explores a search result, the string is changed to reflect the name of the content being explored.On the right side, a clock and/or an indicator that the options key (*) is available can be displayed. If both are displayed, a vertical divider is drawn to separate them.The appearance and contents of the Overhang can be customized by setting its fields to the desired values.

inheritParentOpacity.name: inheritParentOpacity
inheritParentOpacity.description: If true, the node opacity is determined by multiplying opacity attribute of the node by the opacity of the parent node, which may have been determined by multiplying the opacity of its ancestor nodes. If false, the node opacity is determined by the opacity attribute set for the node or the default opacity attribute value.
inheritParentOpacity.descriptionHTML: If true, the node opacity is determined by multiplying opacity attribute of the node by the opacity of the parent node, which may have been determined by multiplying the opacity of its ancestor nodes. If false, the node opacity is determined by the opacity attribute set for the node or the default opacity attribute value.

focusedChild.name: focusedChild
focusedChild.description: When a node or one of its children gains or loses the keyboard focus, the focusedChild field will be set and call its observer functions. In the observer function, typically, you use ifSGNodeFocus functions to query whether this node or some other node has the key focus or is in the key focus chain. Accessing the value of the field will result in script errors.
focusedChild.descriptionHTML:
When a node or one of its children gains or loses the keyboard focus, the focusedChild field will be set and call its observer functions. In the observer function, typically, you use ifSGNodeFocus functions to query whether this node or some other node has the key focus or is in the key focus chain.

Accessing the value of the field will result in script errors.

scale.name: scale
scale.description: Defines the scale factor to be applied to the node local coordinate
scale.descriptionHTML: Defines the scale factor to be applied to the node local coordinate

bulletTextFont.name: bulletTextFont
bulletTextFont.description: When set, the font of the bullet point text
bulletTextFont.descriptionHTML: When set, the font of the bullet point text

buttonFocused.name: buttonFocused
buttonFocused.description: Read-Only Set to the index of the focused button whenever a button in the group receives the key focus.
buttonFocused.descriptionHTML:
Read-Only
Set to the index of the focused button whenever a button in the group receives the key focus.

messageColor.name: messageColor
messageColor.description: When set, the color of the message text
messageColor.descriptionHTML: When set, the color of the message text

messageFont.name: messageFont
messageFont.description: When set, the font of the message text
messageFont.descriptionHTML: When set, the font of the message text

graphicUri.name: graphicUri
graphicUri.description: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed in the dialog. The bitmap is displayed below the bullet text region and above the buttons. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
graphicUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed in the dialog. The bitmap is displayed below the bullet text region and above the buttons. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

id.name: id
id.description: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function
id.descriptionHTML: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function

close.name: close
close.description: Write-Only Causes the dialog to be dismissed. The dialog is dismissed whenever the close field is set, regardless of whether the field is set to true or false.
close.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only
Causes the dialog to be dismissed. The dialog is dismissed whenever the close field is set, regardless of whether the field is set to true or false.

iconUri.name: iconUri
iconUri.description: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as a small icon next to the dialog title. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
iconUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as a small icon next to the dialog title. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

focusButton.name: focusButton
focusButton.description: Write-Only  Causes the button with the specified index to receive the focus when the ButtonGroup node has the key focus. Note that if the ButtonGroup node does not have the key focus when the focusButton field is set, the specified button will display the focus footprint as its background.
focusButton.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only 
Causes the button with the specified index to receive the focus when the ButtonGroup node has the key focus. Note that if the ButtonGroup node does not have the key focus when the focusButton field is set, the specified button will display the focus footprint as its background.

scaleRotateCenter.name: scaleRotateCenter
scaleRotateCenter.description: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations
scaleRotateCenter.descriptionHTML: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations

buttons.name: buttons
buttons.description: Write-Only Allows a set of Button nodes to be easily created by providing an array of Button labels. Each string in the array will result in a Button node to be added to the ButtonGroup, using the string as the Button label.
buttons.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only
Allows a set of Button nodes to be easily created by providing an array of Button labels. Each string in the array will result in a Button node to be added to the ButtonGroup, using the string as the Button label.

buttonGroup.name: buttonGroup
buttonGroup.description: The dialog internal ButtonGroup node. This allows the appearance attributes of all the Button nodes in the dialog to be easily modified. Since the ButtonGroup node class is derived from the LayoutGroup node class, additional non-Button node children can also be added.
buttonGroup.descriptionHTML: The dialog internal ButtonGroup node. This allows the appearance attributes of all the Button nodes in the dialog to be easily modified. Since the ButtonGroup node class is derived from the LayoutGroup node class, additional non-Button node children can also be added.

visible.name: visible
visible.description: If true, the node and its children are rendered. If false, the node and its children do not render.
visible.descriptionHTML: If true, the node and its children are rendered. If false, the node and its children do not render.

buttonSelected.name: buttonSelected
buttonSelected.description: Read-Only Set to the index of the selected button whenever the user selects a button in the group.
buttonSelected.descriptionHTML:
Read-Only
Set to the index of the selected button whenever the user selects a button in the group.

optionsDialog.name: optionsDialog
optionsDialog.description: If set to true, the dialog is automatically dismissed when the Options key is pressed.
optionsDialog.descriptionHTML: If set to true, the dialog is automatically dismissed when the Options key is pressed.

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.description: Defines the rotation angle about the scaleRotateCenter point (in radians) of the node local coordinate system. Positive values specify a counterclockwise rotation, negative values specify a clockwise rotation. For some Roku Player hardware, specifically Roku Players without OpenGL graphics support, only rotations of 0, 90, 180 and 270 degrees (in equivalent radians) are supported. (See Roku Models and Features for information on OpenGL support.)
rotation.descriptionHTML: Defines the rotation angle about the scaleRotateCenter point (in radians) of the node local coordinate system. Positive values specify a counterclockwise rotation, negative values specify a clockwise rotation. For some Roku Player hardware, specifically Roku Players without OpenGL graphics support, only rotations of 0, 90, 180 and 270 degrees (in equivalent radians) are supported. (See Roku Models and Features  for information on OpenGL support.)

change.name: change
change.description: Read-Only Operations affecting the set of children of a Node are recorded in this field if, and only if, this field has been observed. The field associative array indicates the operation and two indexes, index1 and index 2, involved in the change. The operation is denoted by these value strings: Value Meaning none No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant insert A child node was inserted at index1 add A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1) remove A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed set The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node clear All the children nodes were removed move The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2 setall All the children nodes were replaced modify A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)
change.descriptionHTML:
Read-Only
Operations affecting the set of children of a Node are recorded in this field if, and only if, this field has been observed. The field associative array indicates the operation and two indexes, index1 and index 2, involved in the change. The operation is denoted by these value strings:

Value Meaning
none No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant
insert A child node was inserted at index1
add A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1)
remove A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed
set The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node
clear All the children nodes were removed
move The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2
setall All the children nodes were replaced
modify A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)

possibleValues.add: A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1)
possibleValues.modify: A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)
possibleValues.move: The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2
possibleValues.set: The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node
possibleValues.clear: All the children nodes were removed
possibleValues.insert: A child node was inserted at index1
possibleValues.none: No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant
possibleValues.setall: All the children nodes were replaced
possibleValues.remove: A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed

busySpinner.name: busySpinner
busySpinner.description: Provides access to the BusySpinner node used by the ProgressDialog node so that the spinner icon and rotation direction can be customized.
busySpinner.descriptionHTML: Provides access to the BusySpinner node used by the ProgressDialog node so that the spinner icon and rotation direction can be customized.

bulletText.name: bulletText
bulletText.description: An array of strings to be displayed as a list of bullet points.
bulletText.descriptionHTML: An array of strings to be displayed as a list of bullet points.

focusable.name: focusable
focusable.description: Provides a hint as to whether or not this node can take the key focus
focusable.descriptionHTML: Provides a hint as to whether or not this node can take the key focus

inheritParentTransform.name: inheritParentTransform
inheritParentTransform.description: If true, the node overall transformation is determined by combining the accumulated transformation matrix of all of its ancestors in the scene graph with the node local 2D transformation matrix described by its translation, rotation, scale and scaleRotateCenter fields. If false, the accumulated transformation of all of its ancestors in the Scene Graph is ignored and only the node local transformation matrix is used. This causes the node to be transformed relative to the root of the Scene Graph (that is, the Scene component).
inheritParentTransform.descriptionHTML: If true, the node overall transformation is determined by combining the accumulated transformation matrix of all of its ancestors in the scene graph with the node local 2D transformation matrix described by its translation, rotation, scale and scaleRotateCenter fields. If false, the accumulated transformation of all of its ancestors in the Scene Graph is ignored and only the node local transformation matrix is used. message.name: message
message.description: The string to be displayed in the message region of the dialog. Newline and carriage return characters in the string result in the message being displayed as several lines of text. In BrightScript, to include a newline in a string, use chr(10). For example: message = "First line" + chr(10) + "Second line"
message.descriptionHTML:
The string to be displayed in the message region of the dialog. Newline and carriage return characters in the string result in the message being displayed as several lines of text. In BrightScript, to include a newline in a string, use chr(10). For example:

message = "First line" + chr(10) + "Second line"

This should never be set to a non-zero value unless you are optimizing the performance of a list or grid rendering by specifying the sequence of rendering operations for sub-elements of the list or grid items, and have set the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid to a value greater than 1. If the numRenderPasses field is set to a value greater than 1, and you set this field for a list or grid item sub-element to 0 (the default), or a value greater than the numRenderPasses field value, the list or grid item sub-element will not render.

childRenderOrder.name: childRenderOrder
childRenderOrder.description: If the value is renderFirst, any drawing done by this node will be done before the node children are rendered. If the value is renderLast, any drawing done by this node will be done after the node children are rendered.
childRenderOrder.descriptionHTML: If the value is renderFirst, any drawing done by this node will be done before the node children are rendered. If the value is renderLast, any drawing done by this node will be done after the node children are rendered.

dividerUri.name: dividerUri
dividerUri.description: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as the divider between the title region and the remainder of the dialog. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
dividerUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as the divider between the title region and the remainder of the dialog. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

clippingRect.name: clippingRect
clippingRect.description: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.
clippingRect.descriptionHTML: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.

bulletTextColor.name: bulletTextColor
bulletTextColor.description: When set, the color of the bullet point text
bulletTextColor.descriptionHTML: When set, the color of the bullet point text

translation.name: translation
translation.description: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.
translation.descriptionHTML: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.

wasClosed.name: wasClosed
wasClosed.description: Observe-Only Set when the dialog has been closed. The field is set when the dialog close field is set, when the Back or Home key has been pressed, when the Options key has been pressed if the optionsDialog field is set to true, and when the dialog is dismissed because another dialog was displayed.
wasClosed.descriptionHTML:
Observe-Only
Set when the dialog has been closed. The field is set when the dialog close field is set, when the Back or Home key has been pressed, when the Options key has been pressed if the optionsDialog field is set to true, and when the dialog is dismissed because another dialog was displayed.

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.

As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. backgroundUri.name: backgroundUri
backgroundUri.description: Specifies the bitmap to be displayed as the dialog background. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
backgroundUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the bitmap to be displayed as the dialog background. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

ProgressDialog.name: ProgressDialog
ProgressDialog.description: The ProgressDialog node class is a special type of Dialog node that includes the dialog title region and a spinning icon as the body of the dialog. The ProgressDialog node class uses a BusySpinner node to display the spinning icon.The message, bulleted text, graphic, and button regions of the dialog should all be empty. If those dialog regions are not empty, the layout of the dialog will likely not look correct.Not all Roku Player hardware supports arbitrary rotations. In particular, some hardware only supports 90 degree rotation increments. In those cases, the icon will step through 90 degree, 180 degree, 270 degree and back to 0 degree rotations, rather than spin smoothly.
ProgressDialog.descriptionHTML: The ProgressDialog node class is a special type of Dialog node that includes the dialog title region and a spinning icon as the body of the dialog. The ProgressDialog node class uses a BusySpinner node to display the spinning icon.The message, bulleted text, graphic, and button regions of the dialog should all be empty. If those dialog regions are not empty, the layout of the dialog will likely not look correct. Not all Roku Player hardware supports arbitrary rotations. In particular, some hardware only supports 90 degree rotation increments. In those cases, the icon will step through 90 degree, 180 degree, 270 degree and back to 0 degree rotations, rather than spin smoothly.

inheritParentOpacity.description: If true, the node opacity is determined by multiplying opacity attribute of the node by the opacity of the parent node, which may have been determined by multiplying the opacity of its ancestor nodes. If false, the node opacity is determined by the opacity attribute set for the node or the default opacity attribute value.

Accessing the value of the field will result in script errors.

focusBitmapUri.name: focusBitmapUri
focusBitmapUri.description: Specifies the button background bitmap file to display when the button has the key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
focusBitmapUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the button background bitmap file to display when the button has the key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

scale.name: scale
scale.description: Defines the scale factor to be applied to the node local coordinate
scale.descriptionHTML: Defines the scale factor to be applied to the node local coordinate

focusedTextColor.name: focusedTextColor
focusedTextColor.description: Specifies the color of the button label when the button has the key focus.
focusedTextColor.descriptionHTML: Specifies the color of the button label when the button has the key focus.

focusedTextFont.name: focusedTextFont
focusedTextFont.description: Specifies the font of the button label when the button has the key focus
focusedTextFont.descriptionHTML: Specifies the font of the button label when the button has the key focus

showFocusFootprint.name: showFocusFootprint
showFocusFootprint.description: Controls whether the focus "footprint" bitmap is displayed when the button does not have the key focus. Since the default value of the showFocusFootprint field is false, the "footprint" bitmap is not displayed by default.
showFocusFootprint.descriptionHTML: Controls whether the focus "footprint" bitmap is displayed when the button does not have the key focus. Since the default value of the showFocusFootprint field is false, the "footprint" bitmap is not displayed by default.

text.name: text
text.description: Specifies the text to be displayed as the button label
text.descriptionHTML: Specifies the text to be displayed as the button label

id.name: id
id.description: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function
id.descriptionHTML: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function

iconUri.name: iconUri
iconUri.description: Specifies a bitmap file for the button icon when the button does not have the key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
iconUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap file for the button icon when the button does not have the key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

maxWidth.name: maxWidth
maxWidth.description: Specifies the maximum width of the button. The maxWidth field must be greater than or equal to the minWidth field.
maxWidth.descriptionHTML: Specifies the maximum width of the button. The maxWidth field must be greater than or equal to the minWidth field.

height.name: height
height.description: Specifies the height of the button.
height.descriptionHTML: Specifies the height of the button.

scaleRotateCenter.name: scaleRotateCenter
scaleRotateCenter.description: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations
scaleRotateCenter.descriptionHTML: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations

visible.name: visible
visible.description: If true, the node and its children are rendered. If false, the node and its children do not render.
visible.descriptionHTML: If true, the node and its children are rendered. If false, the node and its children do not render.

buttonSelected.name: buttonSelected
buttonSelected.description: Observe-Only The buttonSelected field is set whenever the button is selected. The field should be used to call observer callback functions when the button is selected.
buttonSelected.descriptionHTML:
Observe-Only
The buttonSelected field is set whenever the button is selected. The field should be used to call observer callback functions when the button is selected.

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.description: Defines the rotation angle about the scaleRotateCenter point (in radians) of the node local coordinate system. Positive values specify a counterclockwise rotation, negative values specify a clockwise rotation. For some Roku Player hardware, specifically Roku Players without OpenGL graphics support, only rotations of 0, 90, 180 and 270 degrees (in equivalent radians) are supported. (See Roku Models and Features for information on OpenGL support.)
rotation.descriptionHTML: Defines the rotation angle about the scaleRotateCenter point (in radians) of the node local coordinate system. Positive values specify a counterclockwise rotation, negative values specify a clockwise rotation. For some Roku Player hardware, specifically Roku Players without OpenGL graphics support, only rotations of 0, 90, 180 and 270 degrees (in equivalent radians) are supported. (See Roku Models and Features  for information on OpenGL support.)

change.name: change
change.description: Read-Only Operations affecting the set of children of a Node are recorded in this field if, and only if, this field has been observed. The field associative array indicates the operation and two indexes, index1 and index 2, involved in the change. The operation is denoted by these value strings: Value Meaning none No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant insert A child node was inserted at index1 add A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1) remove A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed set The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node clear All the children nodes were removed move The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2 setall All the children nodes were replaced modify A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)
change.descriptionHTML:
Read-Only
Operations affecting the set of children of a Node are recorded in this field if, and only if, this field has been observed. The field associative array indicates the operation and two indexes, index1 and index 2, involved in the change. The operation is denoted by these value strings:

Value Meaning
none No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant
insert A child node was inserted at index1
add A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1)
remove A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed
set The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node
clear All the children nodes were removed
move The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2
setall All the children nodes were replaced
modify A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)

possibleValues.add: A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1)
possibleValues.modify: A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)
possibleValues.move: The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2
possibleValues.set: The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node
possibleValues.clear: All the children nodes were removed
possibleValues.insert: A child node was inserted at index1
possibleValues.none: No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant
possibleValues.setall: All the children nodes were replaced
possibleValues.remove: A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed

minWidth.name: minWidth
minWidth.description: Specifies the minimum width of the button. The minWidth field must be less than or equal to the maxWidth field.
minWidth.descriptionHTML: Specifies the minimum width of the button. The minWidth field must be less than or equal to the maxWidth field.

focusable.name: focusable
focusable.description: Provides a hint as to whether or not this node can take the key focus
focusable.descriptionHTML: Provides a hint as to whether or not this node can take the key focus

inheritParentTransform.name: inheritParentTransform
inheritParentTransform.description: If true, the node overall transformation is determined by combining the accumulated transformation matrix of all of its ancestors in the scene graph with the node local 2D transformation matrix described by its translation, rotation, scale and scaleRotateCenter fields. If false, the accumulated transformation of all of its ancestors in the Scene Graph is ignored and only the node local transformation matrix is used. This causes the node to be transformed relative to the root of the Scene Graph (that is, the Scene component).
inheritParentTransform.descriptionHTML: If true, the node overall transformation is determined by combining the accumulated transformation matrix of all of its ancestors in the scene graph with the node local 2D transformation matrix described by its translation, rotation, scale and scaleRotateCenter fields. If false, the accumulated transformation of all of its ancestors in the Scene Graph is ignored and only the node local transformation matrix is used. This causes the node to be transformed relative to the root of the Scene Graph (that is, the Scene component).

textColor.name: textColor
textColor.description: Specifies the color of the button label when the button does not have the key focus.
textColor.descriptionHTML: Specifies the color of the button label when the button does not have the key focus.

renderPass.name: renderPass
renderPass.description: Used in combination with the numRenderPasses field of nodes extended from the  abstract node class, to optimize rendering of lists and grids. This should never be set to a non-zero value unless you are optimizing the performance of a list or grid rendering by specifying the sequence of rendering operations for sub-elements of the list or grid items, and have set the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid to a value greater than 1. If the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid is set to a value greater than 1, you must set this field to a value greater than 0 for all sub-elements of the list or grid items, and not greater than the numRenderPasses field value. If the numRenderPasses field is set to a value greater than 1, and you set this field for a list or grid item sub-element to 0 (the default), or a value greater than the numRenderPasses field value, the list or grid item sub-element will not render.
renderPass.descriptionHTML: Used in combination with the numRenderPasses field of nodes extended from the  abstract node class, to optimize rendering of lists and grids. This should never be set to a non-zero value unless you are optimizing the performance of a list or grid rendering by specifying the sequence of rendering operations for sub-elements of the list or grid items, and have set the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid to a value greater than 1. If the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid is set to a value greater than 1, you must set this field to a value greater than 0 for all sub-elements of the list or grid items, and not greater than the numRenderPasses field value. If the numRenderPasses field is set to a value greater than 1, and you set this field for a list or grid item sub-element to 0 (the default), or a value greater than the numRenderPasses field value, the list or grid item sub-element will not render.

childRenderOrder.name: childRenderOrder
childRenderOrder.description: If the value is renderFirst, any drawing done by this node will be done before the node children are rendered. If the value is renderLast, any drawing done by this node will be done after the node children are rendered.
childRenderOrder.descriptionHTML: If the value is renderFirst, any drawing done by this node will be done before the node children are rendered. If the value is renderLast, any drawing done by this node will be done after the node children are rendered.

clippingRect.name: clippingRect
clippingRect.description: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.
clippingRect.descriptionHTML: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.

focusFootprintBitmapUri.name: focusFootprintBitmapUri
focusFootprintBitmapUri.description: Specifies the button focus "footprint" bitmap file to display when the button does not have key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap. By default the "footprint" bitmap is not displayed when the button does not have the key focus. To display the background when the button is unfocused, the showFocusFootprint field must be set to true.
focusFootprintBitmapUri.descriptionHTML:
Specifies the button focus "footprint" bitmap file to display when the button does not have key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

By default the "footprint" bitmap is not displayed when the button does not have the key focus. To display the background when the button is unfocused, the showFocusFootprint field must be set to true.

translation.name: translation
translation.description: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.
translation.descriptionHTML: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.

textFont.name: textFont
textFont.description: Specifies the font of the button label when the button does not have the key focus
textFont.descriptionHTML: Specifies the font of the button label when the button does not have the key focus

focusedIconUri.name: focusedIconUri
focusedIconUri.description: Specifies a bitmap file for the button icon when the button has the key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
focusedIconUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap file for the button icon when the button has the key focus. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.
opacity.descriptionHTML: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.

Button.name: Button
Button.description: The Button node is a simple widget that generates a buttonSelected event when the user selects it. The button can display a label and/or an icon, as well as a background image. Fields are provided to customize the label text and color depending on whether or not the button has the key focus. Similarly, the bitmaps used for the icon and background can be specified for both focused and unfocused button states.By default, the background of the button is only shown when the button has the key focus. Buttons are typically used in a ButtonGroup node that manages which button in the group will have the key focus when the ButtonGroup node receives the focus. When the ButtonGroup node has the focus, the button in the group that has the focus will display the focusBitmapUri bitmap as its background. When the ButtonGroup node does not have the focus, it remembers which button in the group had the focus and sets that button showFocusFootprint field to true, causing it to a render a "footprint" bitmap as a visual indicator that it will be the focused button when the ButtonGroup node receives the focus again. All other buttons in the ButtonGroup node do not display a background image.When a Button node is created that is not a child of a ButtonGroup node, typically the showFootprintfield field should be set to true, so that the button always displays a background image.
Button.descriptionHTML: The Button node is a simple widget that generates a buttonSelected event when the user selects it. The button can display a label and/or an icon, as well as a background image. Fields are provided to customize the label text and color depending on whether or not the button has the key focus. Similarly, the bitmaps used for the icon and background can be specified for both focused and unfocused button states.By default, the background of the button is only shown when the button has the key focus. Buttons are typically used in a ButtonGroup node that manages which button in the group will have the key focus when the ButtonGroup node receives the focus. When the ButtonGroup node has the focus, the button in the group that has the focus will display the focusBitmapUri bitmap as its background. When the ButtonGroup node does not have the focus, it remembers which button in the group had the focus and sets that button showFocusFootprint field to true, causing it to a render a "footprint" bitmap as a visual indicator that it will be the focused button when the ButtonGroup node receives the focus again. All other buttons in the ButtonGroup node do not display a background image.When a Button node is created that is not a child of a ButtonGroup node, typically the showFootprintfield field should be set to true, so that the button always displays a background image.

inheritParentOpacity.name: inheritParentOpacity
inheritParentOpacity.description: If true, the node opacity is determined by multiplying opacity attribute of the node by the opacity of the parent node, which may have been determined by multiplying the opacity of its ancestor nodes. If false, the node opacity is determined by the opacity attribute set for the node or the default opacity attribute value.
inheritParentOpacity.descriptionHTML: If true, the node opacity is determined by multiplying opacity attribute of the node by the opacity of the parent node, which may have been determined by multiplying the opacity of its ancestor nodes. If false, the node opacity is determined by the opacity attribute set for the node or the default opacity attribute value.

focusedChild.name: focusedChild
focusedChild.description: When a node or one of its children gains or loses the keyboard focus, the focusedChild field will be set and call its observer functions. In the observer function, typically, you use ifSGNodeFocus functions to query whether this node or some other node has the key focus or is in the key focus chain. Accessing the value of the field will result in script errors.
focusedChild.descriptionHTML:
When a node or one of its children gains or loses the keyboard focus, the focusedChild field will be set and call its observer functions. In the observer function, typically, you use ifSGNodeFocus functions to query whether this node or some other node has the key focus or is in the key focus chain.

Accessing the value of the field will result in script errors.

scale.description: Defines the scale factor to be applied to the node local coordinate
scale.descriptionHTML: Defines the scale factor to be applied to the node local coordinate

bulletTextFont.name: bulletTextFont
bulletTextFont.description: When set, the font of the bullet point text
bulletTextFont.descriptionHTML: When set, the font of the bullet point text

buttonFocused.name: buttonFocused

Read-Only
Set to the index of the focused button whenever a button in the group receives the key focus.

messageFont.descriptionHTML: When set, the font of the message text

graphicUri.name: graphicUri
graphicUri.description: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed in the dialog. The bitmap is displayed below the bullet text region and above the buttons. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
graphicUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed in the dialog. The bitmap is displayed below the bullet text region and above the buttons. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

id.name: id
id.description: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function
id.descriptionHTML: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function

close.name: close
close.description: Write-Only Causes the dialog to be dismissed. The dialog is dismissed whenever the close field is set, regardless of whether the field is set to true or false.
close.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only
Causes the dialog to be dismissed. The dialog is dismissed whenever the close field is set, regardless of whether the field is set to true or false.

iconUri.name: iconUri
iconUri.description: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as a small icon next to the dialog title. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
iconUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as a small icon next to the dialog title. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

focusButton.name: focusButton
focusButton.description: Write-Only  Causes the button with the specified index to receive the focus when the ButtonGroup node has the key focus. Note that if the ButtonGroup node does not have the key focus when the focusButton field is set, the specified button will display the focus footprint as its background.
focusButton.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only 
Causes the button with the specified index to receive the focus when the ButtonGroup node has the key focus. Note that if the ButtonGroup node does not have the key focus when the focusButton field is set, the specified button will display the focus footprint as its background.

scaleRotateCenter.name: scaleRotateCenter
scaleRotateCenter.description: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations
scaleRotateCenter.descriptionHTML: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations

buttons.name: buttons
buttons.description: Write-Only Allows a set of Button nodes to be easily created by providing an array of Button labels. Each string in the array will result in a Button node to be added to the ButtonGroup, using the string as the Button label.
buttons.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only
Allows a set of Button nodes to be easily created by providing an array of Button labels. Each string in the array will result in a Button node to be added to the ButtonGroup, using the string as the Button label.

buttonGroup.name: buttonGroup
buttonGroup.description: The dialog internal ButtonGroup node. This allows the appearance attributes of all the Button nodes in the dialog to be easily modified. Since the ButtonGroup node class is derived from the LayoutGroup node class, additional non-Button node children can also be added.
buttonGroup.descriptionHTML: The dialog internal ButtonGroup node. This allows the appearance attributes of all the Button nodes in the dialog to be easily modified. Since the ButtonGroup node class is derived from the LayoutGroup node class, additional non-Button node children can also be added.

visible.name: visible
visible.description: If true, the node and its children are rendered. If false, the node and its children do not render.
visible.descriptionHTML: If true, the node and its children are rendered. If false, the node and its children do not render.

buttonSelected.name: buttonSelected
buttonSelected.description: Read-Only Set to the index of the selected button whenever the user selects a button in the group.
buttonSelected.descriptionHTML:
Read-Only
Set to the index of the selected button whenever the user selects a button in the group.

optionsDialog.name: optionsDialog
optionsDialog.description: If set to true, the dialog is automatically dismissed when the Options key is pressed.
optionsDialog.descriptionHTML: If set to true, the dialog is automatically dismissed when the Options key is pressed.

For some Roku Player hardware, specifically Roku Players without OpenGL graphics support, only rotations of 0, 90, 180 and 270 degrees (in equivalent radians) are supported. change.description: Read-Only Operations affecting the set of children of a Node are recorded in this field if, and only if, this field has been observed. The operation is denoted by these value strings: Value Meaning none No operation on the children nodes since the change field was observed, indexes are irrelevant insert A child node was inserted at index1 add A child node was added to the end of the children node tree (at index 1) remove A child node was removed from position index1, and if index2>index1, all the children nodes between index1 and index2 inclusive were removed set The child node at position index1 was replaced with a new child node clear All the children nodes were removed move The child node at position index1 was moved to the new position index2 setall All the children nodes were replaced modify A pre-defined content meta-data field of a ContentNode node child at index1 was changed (only set for ContentNode node children when a pre-defined content meta-data field changes)

message.name: message
message.description: The string to be displayed in the message region of the dialog. Newline and carriage return characters in the string result in the message being displayed as several lines of text. In BrightScript, to include a newline in a string, use chr(10). For example: message = "First line" + chr(10) + "Second line"
message.descriptionHTML:
The string to be displayed in the message region of the dialog. Newline and carriage return characters in the string result in the message being displayed as several lines of text. In BrightScript, to include a newline in a string, use chr(10). For example:

message = "First line" + chr(10) + "Second line"

renderPass.name: renderPass
renderPass.description: Used in combination with the numRenderPasses field of nodes extended from the  abstract node class, to optimize rendering of lists and grids. This should never be set to a non-zero value unless you are optimizing the performance of a list or grid rendering by specifying the sequence of rendering operations for sub-elements of the list or grid items, and have set the numRenderPasses field value for the list or grid to a value greater than 1. If the numRenderPasses field is set to a value greater than 1, and you set this field for a list or grid item sub-element to 0 (the default), or a value greater than the numRenderPasses field value, the list or grid item sub-element will not render.

dividerUri.name: dividerUri
dividerUri.description: Specifies a bitmap to be displayed as the divider between the title region and the remainder of the dialog. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

clippingRect.name: clippingRect
clippingRect.description: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.
clippingRect.descriptionHTML: Specifies a rectangle in the node local coordinate system that is used to limit the region where this node and its children can render. If a non-empty rectangle is specified, then all drawing by this node and its children will be limited to that rectangular area.

bulletTextColor.name: bulletTextColor
bulletTextColor.description: When set, the color of the bullet point text
bulletTextColor.descriptionHTML: When set, the color of the bullet point text

translation.name: translation
translation.description: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.
translation.descriptionHTML: Defines the origin of the node local coordinate system relative to its parent node.

wasClosed.name: wasClosed
wasClosed.description: Observe-Only Set when the dialog has been closed. The field is set when the dialog close field is set, when the Back or Home key has been pressed, when the Options key has been pressed if the optionsDialog field is set to true, and when the dialog is dismissed because another dialog was displayed.
wasClosed.descriptionHTML:
Observe-Only
Set when the dialog has been closed. The field is set when the dialog close field is set, when the Back or Home key has been pressed, when the Options key has been pressed if the optionsDialog field is set to true, and when the dialog is dismissed because another dialog was displayed.

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.
opacity.descriptionHTML: Sets the opacity of the node and its children. Opacity is the opposite of transparency. Opacity values range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque). As the scene graph is traversed, the opacity values are combined by multiplying the current accumulated opacity with the node opacity, so that if the accumulated opacity of a node ancestors is 0.25 (75% transparent), the node will have opacity of 0.25 or less. This allows entire branches of the scene graph to fade in and out by animating the opacity of the node at the root of the branch.

backgroundUri.name: backgroundUri
backgroundUri.description: Specifies the bitmap to be displayed as the dialog background. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
backgroundUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the bitmap to be displayed as the dialog background. Usually this is a 9-patch image to support dynamic resizing. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

Dialog.name: Dialog
Dialog.description: The Dialog node class defines a modal pop-up dialog used to present the user with information requiring their immediate attention.Setting the dialog field of the current Scene node to a Dialog node causes the dialog to be displayed.The Dialog node is configured to have up to five regions: the title, message, bullet text, graphic, and button regions. All of these are optional except for the title.The title region consists of a an icon and a title label, along with a horizontal divider that visually separates the title from the rest of the dialog.The message region consist of a string that is displayed below the title divider.The bullet  text region contains a set of zero or more bullet points. It is displayed below the message.The graphic region consists of a single bitmap displayed center-aligned below the message and bullet text and above the button region.The button region contains a ButtonGroup node that contains zero or more Button nodes, arranged vertically.Dialogs are modal and intercept all key events except pressing the Home key. Dialogs are closed automatically when the user presses the Home key or the Back key. If the optionsDialog field is set to true, pressing the Options key also closes the dialog.Only a single dialog may appear at any time. If a second dialog is shown, the previous dialog is closed automatically.
Dialog.descriptionHTML: The Dialog node class defines a modal pop-up dialog used to present the user with information requiring their immediate attention.Setting the dialog field of the current Scene node to a Dialog node causes the dialog to be displayed.The Dialog node is configured to have up to five regions: the title, message, bullet text, graphic, and button regions. All of these are optional except for the title.The title region consists of a an icon and a title label, along with a horizontal divider that visually separates the title from the rest of the dialog.The message region consist of a string that is displayed below the title divider.The bullet  text region contains a set of zero or more bullet points. It is displayed below the message.The graphic region consists of a single bitmap displayed center-aligned below the message and bullet text and above the button region.The button region contains a ButtonGroup node that contains zero or more Button nodes, arranged vertically.Dialogs are modal and intercept all key events except pressing the Home key. Dialogs are closed automatically when the user presses the Home key or the Back key. If the optionsDialog field is set to true, pressing the Options key also closes the dialog.Only a single dialog may appear at any time. If a second dialog is shown, the previous dialog is closed automatically.

wrapDividerWidth.name: wrapDividerWidth
wrapDividerWidth.description: If the vertFocusAnimationStyle field value is set to fixedFocusWrap, specifies the width of a bitmap used as a visual divider between the last and first list or grid items when the list or grid wraps. Only set this field to use a value with a different appearance than the system default.
wrapDividerWidth.descriptionHTML: If the vertFocusAnimationStyle field value is set to fixedFocusWrap, specifies the width of a bitmap used as a visual divider between the last and first list or grid items when the list or grid wraps. Only set this field to use a value with a different appearance than the system default.

animateToItem.name: animateToItem
animateToItem.description: Write-Only When set to a valid item index, this causes the list to quickly scroll so that the specified index moves into the focus position.
animateToItem.descriptionHTML:
Write-Only
When set to a valid item index, this causes the list to quickly scroll so that the specified index moves into the focus position.

checkOnSelect.name: checkOnSelect
checkOnSelect.description: Controls whether or not pressing the remote control OK key causes the checkedState field to automatically toggle the checked state of the currently focused list item. By default, field value is set to true, but there are use cases where other behavior may be desired. In those cases, it is up to the developer to manage the checked state of the list items by setting the checkedState field to the desired index.
checkOnSelect.descriptionHTML: Controls whether or not pressing the remote control OK key causes the checkedState field to automatically toggle the checked state of the currently focused list item. By default, field value is set to true, but there are use cases where other behavior may be desired. In those cases, it is up to the developer to manage the checked state of the list items by setting the checkedState field to the desired index.

horizFocusAnimationStyle.name: horizFocusAnimationStyle
horizFocusAnimationStyle.description: Specifies the how the focus indicator moves in a row of grid items in response to the remote direction pad Left and Right key presses. This field is not used for lists. The possible values are: Option Effect floatingFocus Causes the focus indicator to float left or right until it reaches the end of the row, at which point the focus indicator will stay fixed on the first or last item in the row, and the items will scroll left or right if there were items that were not visible. fixedFocusWrap Causes the row to wrap around when the focus indicator reaches the first or last item in the row, as long as the row contains enough items to fill the row. If the row does not contain enough items to fill the row, the focus indicator will float left and right.
horizFocusAnimationStyle.descriptionHTML:
Specifies the how the focus indicator moves in a row of grid items in response to the remote direction pad Left and Right key presses. This field is not used for lists. The possible values are:

Option Effect
floatingFocus Causes the focus indicator to float left or right until it reaches the end of the row, at which point the focus indicator will stay fixed on the first or last item in the row, and the items will scroll left or right if there were items that were not visible.
fixedFocusWrap Causes the row to wrap around when the focus indicator reaches the first or last item in the row, as long as the row contains enough items to fill the row. If the row does not contain enough items to fill the row, the focus indicator will float left and right.

possibleValues.floatingFocus: Causes the focus indicator to float left or right until it reaches the end of the row, at which point the focus indicator will stay fixed on the first or last item in the row, and the items will scroll left or right if there were items that were not visible.
possibleValues.fixedFocusWrap: Causes the row to wrap around when the focus indicator reaches the first or last item in the row, as long as the row contains enough items to fill the row. If the row does not contain enough items to fill the row, the focus indicator will float left and right.

focusBitmapUri.name: focusBitmapUri
focusBitmapUri.description: Specifies the bitmap file used for the focus indicator when the list has focus. In most cases, this should be a 9-patch image that specifies both expandable regions as well as margins. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
focusBitmapUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the bitmap file used for the focus indicator when the list has focus. In most cases, this should be a 9-patch image that specifies both expandable regions as well as margins. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

focusedColor.name: focusedColor
focusedColor.description: Specifies the text color for focused list items
focusedColor.descriptionHTML: Specifies the text color for focused list items

drawFocusFeedback.name: drawFocusFeedback
drawFocusFeedback.description: Specifies whether or not the focus indicator bitmap is displayed
drawFocusFeedback.descriptionHTML: Specifies whether or not the focus indicator bitmap is displayed

itemSpacing.name: itemSpacing
itemSpacing.description: The second value of the vector specifies the vertical spacing between items in the list. The first value of the vector is ignored.
itemSpacing.descriptionHTML: The second value of the vector specifies the vertical spacing between items in the list. The first value of the vector is ignored.

wrapDividerBitmapUri.name: wrapDividerBitmapUri
wrapDividerBitmapUri.description: Specifies the bitmap file to use as a wrap divider, the visual separator between the last and first list items when the list wraps. In most cases, this should be a 9-patch image that specifies both expandable regions. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
wrapDividerBitmapUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the bitmap file to use as a wrap divider, the visual separator between the last and first list items when the list wraps. In most cases, this should be a 9-patch image that specifies both expandable regions. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

sectionDividerFont.name: sectionDividerFont
sectionDividerFont.description: Specifies the font for section divider labels
sectionDividerFont.descriptionHTML: Specifies the font for section divider labels

checkedIconUri.name: checkedIconUri
checkedIconUri.description: Specifies the checkbox icon to use for list items that are in the checked state when that list item does not the key focus. Typically, the icon will include the outline of a box with a checkmark indicator inside. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.
checkedIconUri.descriptionHTML: Specifies the checkbox icon to use for list items that are in the checked state when that list item does not the key focus. Typically, the icon will include the outline of a box with a checkmark indicator inside. Only set this field to specify a custom bitmap that differs in appearance from the default bitmap.

itemFocused.name: itemFocused
itemFocused.description: Read-Only When a list item gains the key focus, set to the index of the focused item.
itemFocused.descriptionHTML:
Read-Only
When a list item gains the key focus, set to the index of the focused item.

columnSpacings.name: columnSpacings
columnSpacings.description: Specifies differing spaces between each grid column, to allow the spacing between columns to vary from column to column. This field is not used by lists. The specified values override the itemSpacing field vector2d X-value for each grid column corresponding to its position in the array, in left to right order. If the array contains fewer elements than the number of columns needed to display all the items in the grid, the itemSpacing field vector2d X-value is used for any unspecified columns.
columnSpacings.descriptionHTML:
Specifies differing spaces between each grid column, to allow the spacing between columns to vary from column to column. This field is not used by lists.

The specified values override the itemSpacing field vector2d X-value for each grid column corresponding to its position in the array, in left to right order. If the array contains fewer elements than the number of columns needed to display all the items in the grid, the itemSpacing field vector2d X-value is used for any unspecified columns.

itemSize.name: itemSize
itemSize.description: Specifies the width and height of each item in the list
itemSize.descriptionHTML: Specifies the width and height of each item in the list

id.name: id
id.description: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function
id.descriptionHTML: Adds a dictionary entry that allows the node to be retrieved with ifSGDictionary findNode() function

sectionDividerTextColor.name: sectionDividerTextColor
sectionDividerTextColor.description: Specifies the text color for section divider labels
sectionDividerTextColor.descriptionHTML: Specifies the text color for section divider labels

numRenderPasses.name: numRenderPasses
numRenderPasses.description: Specifies the number of rendering operations to display a complex list or grid. This allows you to achieve a performance increase by specifying that individual sub-elements of the list or grid items occur on sequential rendering operations, rather than all of the item sub-elements being rendered in one rendering operation, which is the default. If you set this field to a value greater than 1, you must specify the rendering operation number for each of the item sub-elements as the renderPass field value for that sub-element. No sub-element that has a renderPass field value of 0 (the default), or has a renderPass field value greater than the value of the numRenderPasses field, will render.
numRenderPasses.descriptionHTML: Specifies the number of rendering operations to display a complex list or grid. This allows you to achieve a performance increase by specifying that individual sub-elements of the list or grid items occur on sequential rendering operations, rather than all of the item sub-elements being rendered in one rendering operation, which is the default. If you set this field to a value greater than 1, you must specify the rendering operation number for each of the item sub-elements as the renderPass field value for that sub-element. No sub-element that has a renderPass field value of 0 (the default), or has a renderPass field value greater than the value of the numRenderPasses field, will render.

drawFocusFeedbackOnTop.name: drawFocusFeedbackOnTop
drawFocusFeedbackOnTop.description: Specifies whether the focus indicator bitmap is drawn below or on top of the list items
drawFocusFeedbackOnTop.descriptionHTML: Specifies whether the focus indicator bitmap is drawn below or on top of the list items

scaleRotateCenter.name: scaleRotateCenter
scaleRotateCenter.description: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations
scaleRotateCenter.descriptionHTML: Describes the location of a point in the node local coordinate that serves as the center of the scale and rotation operations

textHorizAlign.name: textHorizAlign
textHorizAlign.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the text in the list item area specified by the itemSize field value (the text is always centered vertically in the list item area). The possible options are: Option Effect left Text is left-aligned right Text is right-aligned center Text is center-aligned
textHorizAlign.descriptionHTML:
